14
15#ifndef DNS_NAME_H
16#define DNS_NAME_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/name.h
23 * \brief
24 * Provides facilities for manipulating DNS names and labels, including
25 * conversions to and from wire format and text format.
26 *
27 * Given the large number of names possible in a nameserver, and because
28 * names occur in rdata, it was important to come up with a very efficient
29 * way of storing name data, but at the same time allow names to be
30 * manipulated. The decision was to store names in uncompressed wire format,
31 * and not to make them fully abstracted objects; i.e. certain parts of the
32 * server know names are stored that way. This saves a lot of memory, and
33 * makes adding names to messages easy. Having much of the server know
34 * the representation would be perilous, and we certainly don't want each
35 * user of names to be manipulating such a low-level structure. This is
36 * where the Names and Labels module comes in. The module allows name or
37 * label handles to be created and attached to uncompressed wire format
38 * regions. All name operations and conversions are done through these
39 * handles.
40 *
41 * MP:
42 *\li Clients of this module must impose any required synchronization.
43 *
44 * Reliability:
45 *\li This module deals with low-level byte streams. Errors in any of
46 * the functions are likely to crash the server or corrupt memory.
47 *
48 * Resources:
49 *\li None.
50 *
51 * Security:
52 *
53 *\li *** WARNING ***
54 *
55 *\li dns_name_fromwire() deals with raw network data. An error in
56 * this routine could result in the failure or hijacking of the server.
57 *
58 * Standards:
59 *\li RFC1035
60 *\li Draft EDNS0 (0)
61 *\li Draft Binary Labels (2)
62 *
63 */
64
65/***
66 *** Imports
67 ***/
68
69#include <stdbool.h>
70#include <stdio.h>
71#include <inttypes.h>
72
73#include <isc/lang.h>
74#include <isc/magic.h>
75#include <isc/region.h> /* Required for storage size of dns_label_t. */
76
77#include <dns/types.h>
78
79ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
80
81/*****
82 ***** Labels
83 *****
84 ***** A 'label' is basically a region. It contains one DNS wire format
85 ***** label of type 00 (ordinary).
86 *****/
87
88/*****
89 ***** Names
90 *****
91 ***** A 'name' is a handle to a binary region. It contains a sequence of one
92 ***** or more DNS wire format labels of type 00 (ordinary).
93 ***** Note that all names are not required to end with the root label,
94 ***** as they are in the actual DNS wire protocol.
95 *****/
96
97/***
98 *** Types
99 ***/
100
101/*%
102 * Clients are strongly discouraged from using this type directly, with
103 * the exception of the 'link' and 'list' fields which may be used directly
104 * for whatever purpose the client desires.
105 */
106struct dns_name {
107 unsigned int magic;
108 unsigned char * ndata;
109 unsigned int length;
110 unsigned int labels;
111 unsigned int attributes;
112 unsigned char * offsets;
113 isc_buffer_t * buffer;
114 ISC_LINK(dns_name_t) link;
115 ISC_LIST(dns_rdataset_t) list;
116};
117
118#define DNS_NAME_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('D','N','S','n')
119
120#define DNS_NAMEATTR_ABSOLUTE 0x00000001
121#define DNS_NAMEATTR_READONLY 0x00000002
122#define DNS_NAMEATTR_DYNAMIC 0x00000004
123#define DNS_NAMEATTR_DYNOFFSETS 0x00000008
124#define DNS_NAMEATTR_NOCOMPRESS 0x00000010
125/*
126 * Attributes below 0x0100 reserved for name.c usage.
127 */
128#define DNS_NAMEATTR_CACHE 0x00000100 /*%< Used by resolver. */
129#define DNS_NAMEATTR_ANSWER 0x00000200 /*%< Used by resolver. */
130#define DNS_NAMEATTR_NCACHE 0x00000400 /*%< Used by resolver. */
131#define DNS_NAMEATTR_CHAINING 0x00000800 /*%< Used by resolver. */
132#define DNS_NAMEATTR_CHASE 0x00001000 /*%< Used by resolver. */
133#define DNS_NAMEATTR_WILDCARD 0x00002000 /*%< Used by server. */
134#define DNS_NAMEATTR_PREREQUISITE 0x00004000 /*%< Used by client. */
135#define DNS_NAMEATTR_UPDATE 0x00008000 /*%< Used by client. */
136#define DNS_NAMEATTR_HASUPDATEREC 0x00010000 /*%< Used by client. */
137
138/*
139 * Various flags.
140 */
141#define DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE 0x0001
142#define DNS_NAME_CHECKNAMES 0x0002 /*%< Used by rdata. */
143#define DNS_NAME_CHECKNAMESFAIL 0x0004 /*%< Used by rdata. */
144#define DNS_NAME_CHECKREVERSE 0x0008 /*%< Used by rdata. */
145#define DNS_NAME_CHECKMX 0x0010 /*%< Used by rdata. */
146#define DNS_NAME_CHECKMXFAIL 0x0020 /*%< Used by rdata. */
147
148LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_rootname;
149LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern const dns_name_t *dns_wildcardname;
150
151/*%<
152 * DNS_NAME_INITNONABSOLUTE and DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE are macros for
153 * initializing dns_name_t structures.
154 *
155 * Note[1]: 'length' is set to (sizeof(A) - 1) in DNS_NAME_INITNONABSOLUTE
156 * and sizeof(A) in DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE to allow C strings to be used
157 * to initialize 'ndata'.
158 *
159 * Note[2]: The final value of offsets for DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE should
160 * match (sizeof(A) - 1) which is the offset of the root label.
161 *
162 * Typical usage:
163 * unsigned char data[] = "\005value";
164 * unsigned char offsets[] = { 0 };
165 * dns_name_t value = DNS_NAME_INITNONABSOLUTE(data, offsets);
166 *
167 * unsigned char data[] = "\005value";
168 * unsigned char offsets[] = { 0, 6 };
169 * dns_name_t value = DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE(data, offsets);
170 */
171#define DNS_NAME_INITNONABSOLUTE(A,B) { \
172 DNS_NAME_MAGIC, \
173 A, (sizeof(A) - 1), sizeof(B), \
174 DNS_NAMEATTR_READONLY, \
175 B, NULL, { (void *)-1, (void *)-1}, \
176 {NULL, NULL} \
177}
178
179#define DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE(A,B) { \
180 DNS_NAME_MAGIC, \
181 A, sizeof(A), sizeof(B), \
182 DNS_NAMEATTR_READONLY | DNS_NAMEATTR_ABSOLUTE, \
183 B, NULL, { (void *)-1, (void *)-1}, \
184 {NULL, NULL} \
185}
186
187#define DNS_NAME_INITEMPTY { \
188 DNS_NAME_MAGIC, NULL, 0, 0, 0, NULL, NULL, \
189 { (void *)-1, (void *)-1 }, { NULL, NULL } \
190}
191
192/*%
193 * Standard size of a wire format name
194 */
195#define DNS_NAME_MAXWIRE 255
196
197/*
198 * Text output filter procedure.
199 * 'target' is the buffer to be converted. The region to be converted
200 * is from 'buffer'->base + 'used_org' to the end of the used region.
201 */
202typedef isc_result_t (*dns_name_totextfilter_t)(isc_buffer_t *target,
203 unsigned int used_org);
204
205/***
206 *** Initialization
207 ***/
208
209void
210dns_name_init(dns_name_t *name, unsigned char *offsets);
211/*%<
212 * Initialize 'name'.
213 *
214 * Notes:
215 * \li 'offsets' is never required to be non-NULL, but specifying a
216 * dns_offsets_t for 'offsets' will improve the performance of most
217 * name operations if the name is used more than once.
218 *
219 * Requires:
220 * \li 'name' is not NULL and points to a struct dns_name.
221 *
222 * \li offsets == NULL or offsets is a dns_offsets_t.
223 *
224 * Ensures:
225 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
226 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name) == 0
227 * \li dns_name_isabsolute(name) == false
228 */
229
230void
231dns_name_reset(dns_name_t *name);
232/*%<
233 * Reinitialize 'name'.
234 *
235 * Notes:
236 * \li This function distinguishes itself from dns_name_init() in two
237 * key ways:
238 *
239 * \li + If any buffer is associated with 'name' (via dns_name_setbuffer()
240 * or by being part of a dns_fixedname_t) the link to the buffer
241 * is retained but the buffer itself is cleared.
242 *
243 * \li + Of the attributes associated with 'name', all are retained except
244 * DNS_NAMEATTR_ABSOLUTE.
245 *
246 * Requires:
247 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
248 *
249 * Ensures:
250 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
251 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name) == 0
252 * \li dns_name_isabsolute(name) == false
253 */
254
255void
256dns_name_invalidate(dns_name_t *name);
257/*%<
258 * Make 'name' invalid.
259 *
260 * Requires:
261 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
262 *
263 * Ensures:
264 * \li If assertion checking is enabled, future attempts to use 'name'
265 * without initializing it will cause an assertion failure.
266 *
267 * \li If the name had a dedicated buffer, that association is ended.
268 */
269
270bool
271dns_name_isvalid(const dns_name_t *name);
272/*%<
273 * Check whether 'name' points to a valid dns_name
274 */
275
276/***
277 *** Dedicated Buffers
278 ***/
279
280void
281dns_name_setbuffer(dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *buffer);
282/*%<
283 * Dedicate a buffer for use with 'name'.
284 *
285 * Notes:
286 * \li Specification of a target buffer in dns_name_fromwire(),
287 * dns_name_fromtext(), and dns_name_concatenate() is optional if
288 * 'name' has a dedicated buffer.
289 *
290 * \li The caller must not write to buffer until the name has been
291 * invalidated or is otherwise known not to be in use.
292 *
293 * \li If buffer is NULL and the name previously had a dedicated buffer,
294 * than that buffer is no longer dedicated to use with this name.
295 * The caller is responsible for ensuring that the storage used by
296 * the name remains valid.
297 *
298 * Requires:
299 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
300 *
301 * \li 'buffer' is a valid binary buffer and 'name' doesn't have a
302 * dedicated buffer already, or 'buffer' is NULL.
303 */
304
305bool
306dns_name_hasbuffer(const dns_name_t *name);
307/*%<
308 * Does 'name' have a dedicated buffer?
309 *
310 * Requires:
311 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
312 *
313 * Returns:
314 * \li true 'name' has a dedicated buffer.
315 * \li false 'name' does not have a dedicated buffer.
316 */
317
318/***
319 *** Properties
320 ***/
321
322bool
323dns_name_isabsolute(const dns_name_t *name);
324/*%<
325 * Does 'name' end in the root label?
326 *
327 * Requires:
328 * \li 'name' is a valid name
329 *
330 * Returns:
331 * \li TRUE The last label in 'name' is the root label.
332 * \li FALSE The last label in 'name' is not the root label.
333 */
334
335bool
336dns_name_iswildcard(const dns_name_t *name);
337/*%<
338 * Is 'name' a wildcard name?
339 *
340 * Requires:
341 * \li 'name' is a valid name
342 *
343 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name) > 0
344 *
345 * Returns:
346 * \li TRUE The least significant label of 'name' is '*'.
347 * \li FALSE The least significant label of 'name' is not '*'.
348 */
349
350unsigned int
351dns_name_hash(const dns_name_t *name, bool case_sensitive);
352/*%<
353 * Provide a hash value for 'name'.
354 *
355 * Note: if 'case_sensitive' is false, then names which differ only in
356 * case will have the same hash value.
357 *
358 * Requires:
359 * \li 'name' is a valid name
360 *
361 * Returns:
362 * \li A hash value
363 */
364
365unsigned int
366dns_name_fullhash(const dns_name_t *name, bool case_sensitive);
367/*%<
368 * Provide a hash value for 'name'. Unlike dns_name_hash(), this function
369 * always takes into account of the entire name to calculate the hash value.
370 *
371 * Note: if 'case_sensitive' is false, then names which differ only in
372 * case will have the same hash value.
373 *
374 * Requires:
375 *\li 'name' is a valid name
376 *
377 * Returns:
378 *\li A hash value
379 */
380
381/*
382 *** Comparisons
383 ***/
384
385dns_namereln_t
386dns_name_fullcompare(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2,
387 int *orderp, unsigned int *nlabelsp);
388/*%<
389 * Determine the relative ordering under the DNSSEC order relation of
390 * 'name1' and 'name2', and also determine the hierarchical
391 * relationship of the names.
392 *
393 * Note: It makes no sense for one of the names to be relative and the
394 * other absolute. If both names are relative, then to be meaningfully
395 * compared the caller must ensure that they are both relative to the
396 * same domain.
397 *
398 * Requires:
399 *\li 'name1' is a valid name
400 *
401 *\li dns_name_countlabels(name1) > 0
402 *
403 *\li 'name2' is a valid name
404 *
405 *\li dns_name_countlabels(name2) > 0
406 *
407 *\li orderp and nlabelsp are valid pointers.
408 *
409 *\li Either name1 is absolute and name2 is absolute, or neither is.
410 *
411 * Ensures:
412 *
413 *\li *orderp is < 0 if name1 < name2, 0 if name1 = name2, > 0 if
414 * name1 > name2.
415 *
416 *\li *nlabelsp is the number of common significant labels.
417 *
418 * Returns:
419 *\li dns_namereln_none There's no hierarchical relationship
420 * between name1 and name2.
421 *\li dns_namereln_contains name1 properly contains name2; i.e.
422 * name2 is a proper subdomain of name1.
423 *\li dns_namereln_subdomain name1 is a proper subdomain of name2.
424 *\li dns_namereln_equal name1 and name2 are equal.
425 *\li dns_namereln_commonancestor name1 and name2 share a common
426 * ancestor.
427 */
428
429int
430dns_name_compare(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2);
431/*%<
432 * Determine the relative ordering under the DNSSEC order relation of
433 * 'name1' and 'name2'.
434 *
435 * Note: It makes no sense for one of the names to be relative and the
436 * other absolute. If both names are relative, then to be meaningfully
437 * compared the caller must ensure that they are both relative to the
438 * same domain.
439 *
440 * Requires:
441 * \li 'name1' is a valid name
442 *
443 * \li 'name2' is a valid name
444 *
445 * \li Either name1 is absolute and name2 is absolute, or neither is.
446 *
447 * Returns:
448 * \li < 0 'name1' is less than 'name2'
449 * \li 0 'name1' is equal to 'name2'
450 * \li > 0 'name1' is greater than 'name2'
451 */
452
453bool
454dns_name_equal(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2);
455/*%<
456 * Are 'name1' and 'name2' equal?
457 *
458 * Notes:
459 * \li Because it only needs to test for equality, dns_name_equal() can be
460 * significantly faster than dns_name_fullcompare() or dns_name_compare().
461 *
462 * \li Offsets tables are not used in the comparision.
463 *
464 * \li It makes no sense for one of the names to be relative and the
465 * other absolute. If both names are relative, then to be meaningfully
466 * compared the caller must ensure that they are both relative to the
467 * same domain.
468 *
469 * Requires:
470 * \li 'name1' is a valid name
471 *
472 * \li 'name2' is a valid name
473 *
474 * \li Either name1 is absolute and name2 is absolute, or neither is.
475 *
476 * Returns:
477 * \li true 'name1' and 'name2' are equal
478 * \li false 'name1' and 'name2' are not equal
479 */
480
481bool
482dns_name_caseequal(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2);
483/*%<
484 * Case sensitive version of dns_name_equal().
485 */
486
487int
488dns_name_rdatacompare(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2);
489/*%<
490 * Compare two names as if they are part of rdata in DNSSEC canonical
491 * form.
492 *
493 * Requires:
494 * \li 'name1' is a valid absolute name
495 *
496 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name1) > 0
497 *
498 * \li 'name2' is a valid absolute name
499 *
500 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name2) > 0
501 *
502 * Returns:
503 * \li < 0 'name1' is less than 'name2'
504 * \li 0 'name1' is equal to 'name2'
505 * \li > 0 'name1' is greater than 'name2'
506 */
507
508bool
509dns_name_issubdomain(const dns_name_t *name1, const dns_name_t *name2);
510/*%<
511 * Is 'name1' a subdomain of 'name2'?
512 *
513 * Notes:
514 * \li name1 is a subdomain of name2 if name1 is contained in name2, or
515 * name1 equals name2.
516 *
517 * \li It makes no sense for one of the names to be relative and the
518 * other absolute. If both names are relative, then to be meaningfully
519 * compared the caller must ensure that they are both relative to the
520 * same domain.
521 *
522 * Requires:
523 * \li 'name1' is a valid name
524 *
525 * \li 'name2' is a valid name
526 *
527 * \li Either name1 is absolute and name2 is absolute, or neither is.
528 *
529 * Returns:
530 * \li TRUE 'name1' is a subdomain of 'name2'
531 * \li FALSE 'name1' is not a subdomain of 'name2'
532 */
533
534bool
535dns_name_matcheswildcard(const dns_name_t *name, const dns_name_t *wname);
536/*%<
537 * Does 'name' match the wildcard specified in 'wname'?
538 *
539 * Notes:
540 * \li name matches the wildcard specified in wname if all labels
541 * following the wildcard in wname are identical to the same number
542 * of labels at the end of name.
543 *
544 * \li It makes no sense for one of the names to be relative and the
545 * other absolute. If both names are relative, then to be meaningfully
546 * compared the caller must ensure that they are both relative to the
547 * same domain.
548 *
549 * Requires:
550 * \li 'name' is a valid name
551 *
552 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name) > 0
553 *
554 * \li 'wname' is a valid name
555 *
556 * \li dns_name_countlabels(wname) > 0
557 *
558 * \li dns_name_iswildcard(wname) is true
559 *
560 * \li Either name is absolute and wname is absolute, or neither is.
561 *
562 * Returns:
563 * \li TRUE 'name' matches the wildcard specified in 'wname'
564 * \li FALSE 'name' does not match the wildcard specified in 'wname'
565 */
566
567/***
568 *** Labels
569 ***/
570
571unsigned int
572dns_name_countlabels(const dns_name_t *name);
573/*%<
574 * How many labels does 'name' have?
575 *
576 * Notes:
577 * \li In this case, as in other places, a 'label' is an ordinary label.
578 *
579 * Requires:
580 * \li 'name' is a valid name
581 *
582 * Ensures:
583 * \li The result is <= 128.
584 *
585 * Returns:
586 * \li The number of labels in 'name'.
587 */
588
589void
590dns_name_getlabel(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int n, dns_label_t *label);
591/*%<
592 * Make 'label' refer to the 'n'th least significant label of 'name'.
593 *
594 * Notes:
595 * \li Numbering starts at 0.
596 *
597 * \li Given "rc.vix.com.", the label 0 is "rc", and label 3 is the
598 * root label.
599 *
600 * \li 'label' refers to the same memory as 'name', so 'name' must not
601 * be changed while 'label' is still in use.
602 *
603 * Requires:
604 * \li n < dns_name_countlabels(name)
605 */
606
607void
608dns_name_getlabelsequence(const dns_name_t *source, unsigned int first,
609 unsigned int n, dns_name_t *target);
610/*%<
611 * Make 'target' refer to the 'n' labels including and following 'first'
612 * in 'source'.
613 *
614 * Notes:
615 * \li Numbering starts at 0.
616 *
617 * \li Given "rc.vix.com.", the label 0 is "rc", and label 3 is the
618 * root label.
619 *
620 * \li 'target' refers to the same memory as 'source', so 'source'
621 * must not be changed while 'target' is still in use.
622 *
623 * Requires:
624 * \li 'source' and 'target' are valid names.
625 *
626 * \li first < dns_name_countlabels(name)
627 *
628 * \li first + n <= dns_name_countlabels(name)
629 */
630
631
632void
633dns_name_clone(const dns_name_t *source, dns_name_t *target);
634/*%<
635 * Make 'target' refer to the same name as 'source'.
636 *
637 * Notes:
638 *
639 * \li 'target' refers to the same memory as 'source', so 'source'
640 * must not be changed while 'target' is still in use.
641 *
642 * \li This call is functionally equivalent to:
643 *
644 * \code
645 * dns_name_getlabelsequence(source, 0,
646 * dns_name_countlabels(source),
647 * target);
648 * \endcode
649 *
650 * but is more efficient. Also, dns_name_clone() works even if 'source'
651 * is empty.
652 *
653 * Requires:
654 *
655 * \li 'source' is a valid name.
656 *
657 * \li 'target' is a valid name that is not read-only.
658 */
659
660/***
661 *** Conversions
662 ***/
663
664void
665dns_name_fromregion(dns_name_t *name, const isc_region_t *r);
666/*%<
667 * Make 'name' refer to region 'r'.
668 *
669 * Note:
670 * \li If the conversion encounters a root label before the end of the
671 * region the conversion stops and the length is set to the length
672 * so far converted. A maximum of 255 bytes is converted.
673 *
674 * Requires:
675 * \li The data in 'r' is a sequence of one or more type 00 or type 01000001
676 * labels.
677 */
678
679void
680dns_name_toregion(const dns_name_t *name, isc_region_t *r);
681/*%<
682 * Make 'r' refer to 'name'.
683 *
684 * Requires:
685 *
686 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
687 *
688 * \li 'r' is a valid region.
689 */
690
691isc_result_t
692dns_name_fromwire(dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *source,
693 dns_decompress_t *dctx, unsigned int options,
694 isc_buffer_t *target);
695/*%<
696 * Copy the possibly-compressed name at source (active region) into target,
697 * decompressing it.
698 *
699 * Notes:
700 * \li Decompression policy is controlled by 'dctx'.
701 *
702 * \li If DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE is set, any uppercase letters in 'source' will be
703 * downcased when they are copied into 'target'.
704 *
705 * Security:
706 *
707 * \li *** WARNING ***
708 *
709 * \li This routine will often be used when 'source' contains raw network
710 * data. A programming error in this routine could result in a denial
711 * of service, or in the hijacking of the server.
712 *
713 * Requires:
714 *
715 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
716 *
717 * \li 'source' is a valid buffer and the first byte of the active
718 * region should be the first byte of a DNS wire format domain name.
719 *
720 * \li 'target' is a valid buffer or 'target' is NULL and 'name' has
721 * a dedicated buffer.
722 *
723 * \li 'dctx' is a valid decompression context.
724 *
725 * Ensures:
726 *
727 * If result is success:
728 * \li If 'target' is not NULL, 'name' is attached to it.
729 *
730 * \li Uppercase letters are downcased in the copy iff
731 * DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE is set in options.
732 *
733 * \li The current location in source is advanced, and the used space
734 * in target is updated.
735 *
736 * Result:
737 * \li Success
738 * \li Bad Form: Label Length
739 * \li Bad Form: Unknown Label Type
740 * \li Bad Form: Name Length
741 * \li Bad Form: Compression type not allowed
742 * \li Bad Form: Bad compression pointer
743 * \li Bad Form: Input too short
744 * \li Resource Limit: Too many compression pointers
745 * \li Resource Limit: Not enough space in buffer
746 */
747
748isc_result_t
749dns_name_towire(const dns_name_t *name, dns_compress_t *cctx,
750 isc_buffer_t *target);
751isc_result_t
752dns_name_towire2(const dns_name_t *name, dns_compress_t *cctx,
753 isc_buffer_t *target, uint16_t *comp_offsetp);
754/*%<
755 * Convert 'name' into wire format, compressing it as specified by the
756 * compression context 'cctx', and storing the result in 'target'.
757 *
758 * Notes:
759 * \li If the compression context allows global compression, then the
760 * global compression table may be updated.
761 *
762 * Requires:
763 * \li 'name' is a valid name
764 *
765 * \li dns_name_countlabels(name) > 0
766 *
767 * \li dns_name_isabsolute(name) == TRUE
768 *
769 * \li target is a valid buffer.
770 *
771 * \li Any offsets specified in a global compression table are valid
772 * for buffer.
773 *
774 * Ensures:
775 *
776 * If the result is success:
777 *
778 * \li The used space in target is updated.
779 *
780 * Returns:
781 * \li Success
782 * \li Resource Limit: Not enough space in buffer
783 */
784
785isc_result_t
786dns_name_fromtext(dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *source,
787 const dns_name_t *origin, unsigned int options,
788 isc_buffer_t *target);
789/*%<
790 * Convert the textual representation of a DNS name at source
791 * into uncompressed wire form stored in target.
792 *
793 * Notes:
794 * \li Relative domain names will have 'origin' appended to them
795 * unless 'origin' is NULL, in which case relative domain names
796 * will remain relative.
797 *
798 * \li If DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE is set in 'options', any uppercase letters
799 * in 'source' will be downcased when they are copied into 'target'.
800 *
801 * Requires:
802 *
803 * \li 'name' is a valid name.
804 *
805 * \li 'source' is a valid buffer.
806 *
807 * \li 'target' is a valid buffer or 'target' is NULL and 'name' has
808 * a dedicated buffer.
809 *
810 * Ensures:
811 *
812 * If result is success:
813 * \li If 'target' is not NULL, 'name' is attached to it.
814 *
815 * \li Uppercase letters are downcased in the copy iff
816 * DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE is set in 'options'.
817 *
818 * \li The current location in source is advanced, and the used space
819 * in target is updated.
820 *
821 * Result:
822 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
823 *\li #DNS_R_EMPTYLABEL
824 *\li #DNS_R_LABELTOOLONG
825 *\li #DNS_R_BADESCAPE
826 *\li #DNS_R_BADDOTTEDQUAD
827 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
828 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDEND
829 */
830
831#define DNS_NAME_OMITFINALDOT 0x01U
832#define DNS_NAME_MASTERFILE 0x02U /* escape $ and @ */
833
834isc_result_t
835dns_name_toprincipal(const dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *target);
836
837isc_result_t
838dns_name_totext(const dns_name_t *name, bool omit_final_dot,
839 isc_buffer_t *target);
840
841isc_result_t
842dns_name_totext2(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int options,
843 isc_buffer_t *target);
844/*%<
845 * Convert 'name' into text format, storing the result in 'target'.
846 *
847 * Notes:
848 *\li If 'omit_final_dot' is true, then the final '.' in absolute
849 * names other than the root name will be omitted.
850 *
851 *\li If DNS_NAME_OMITFINALDOT is set in options, then the final '.'
852 * in absolute names other than the root name will be omitted.
853 *
854 *\li If DNS_NAME_MASTERFILE is set in options, '$' and '@' will also
855 * be escaped.
856 *
857 *\li If dns_name_countlabels == 0, the name will be "@", representing the
858 * current origin as described by RFC1035.
859 *
860 *\li The name is not NUL terminated.
861 *
862 * Requires:
863 *
864 *\li 'name' is a valid name
865 *
866 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer.
867 *
868 *\li if dns_name_isabsolute == FALSE, then omit_final_dot == FALSE
869 *
870 * Ensures:
871 *
872 *\li If the result is success:
873 * the used space in target is updated.
874 *
875 * Returns:
876 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
877 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
878 */
879
880#define DNS_NAME_MAXTEXT 1023
881/*%<
882 * The maximum length of the text representation of a domain
883 * name as generated by dns_name_totext(). This does not
884 * include space for a terminating NULL.
885 *
886 * This definition is conservative - the actual maximum
887 * is 1004, derived as follows:
888 *
889 * A backslash-decimal escaped character takes 4 bytes.
890 * A wire-encoded name can be up to 255 bytes and each
891 * label is one length byte + at most 63 bytes of data.
892 * Maximizing the label lengths gives us a name of
893 * three 63-octet labels, one 61-octet label, and the
894 * root label:
895 *
896 * 1 + 63 + 1 + 63 + 1 + 63 + 1 + 61 + 1 = 255
897 *
898 * When printed, this is (3 * 63 + 61) * 4
899 * bytes for the escaped label data + 4 bytes for the
900 * dot terminating each label = 1004 bytes total.
901 */
902
903isc_result_t
904dns_name_tofilenametext(const dns_name_t *name, bool omit_final_dot,
905 isc_buffer_t *target);
906/*%<
907 * Convert 'name' into an alternate text format appropriate for filenames,
908 * storing the result in 'target'. The name data is downcased, guaranteeing
909 * that the filename does not depend on the case of the converted name.
910 *
911 * Notes:
912 *\li If 'omit_final_dot' is true, then the final '.' in absolute
913 * names other than the root name will be omitted.
914 *
915 *\li The name is not NUL terminated.
916 *
917 * Requires:
918 *
919 *\li 'name' is a valid absolute name
920 *
921 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer.
922 *
923 * Ensures:
924 *
925 *\li If the result is success:
926 * the used space in target is updated.
927 *
928 * Returns:
929 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
930 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
931 */
932
933isc_result_t
934dns_name_downcase(const dns_name_t *source, dns_name_t *name,
935 isc_buffer_t *target);
936/*%<
937 * Downcase 'source'.
938 *
939 * Requires:
940 *
941 *\li 'source' and 'name' are valid names.
942 *
943 *\li If source == name, then
944 * 'source' must not be read-only
945 *
946 *\li Otherwise,
947 * 'target' is a valid buffer or 'target' is NULL and
948 * 'name' has a dedicated buffer.
949 *
950 * Returns:
951 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
952 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
953 *
954 * Note: if source == name, then the result will always be ISC_R_SUCCESS.
955 */
956
957isc_result_t
958dns_name_concatenate(const dns_name_t *prefix, const dns_name_t *suffix,
959 dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *target);
960/*%<
961 * Concatenate 'prefix' and 'suffix'.
962 *
963 * Requires:
964 *
965 *\li 'prefix' is a valid name or NULL.
966 *
967 *\li 'suffix' is a valid name or NULL.
968 *
969 *\li 'name' is a valid name or NULL.
970 *
971 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer or 'target' is NULL and 'name' has
972 * a dedicated buffer.
973 *
974 *\li If 'prefix' is absolute, 'suffix' must be NULL or the empty name.
975 *
976 * Ensures:
977 *
978 *\li On success,
979 * If 'target' is not NULL and 'name' is not NULL, then 'name'
980 * is attached to it.
981 * The used space in target is updated.
982 *
983 * Returns:
984 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
985 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
986 *\li #DNS_R_NAMETOOLONG
987 */
988
989void
990dns_name_split(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int suffixlabels,
991 dns_name_t *prefix, dns_name_t *suffix);
992/*%<
993 *
994 * Split 'name' into two pieces on a label boundary.
995 *
996 * Notes:
997 * \li 'name' is split such that 'suffix' holds the most significant
998 * 'suffixlabels' labels. All other labels are stored in 'prefix'.
999 *
1000 *\li Copying name data is avoided as much as possible, so 'prefix'
1001 * and 'suffix' will end up pointing at the data for 'name'.
1002 *
1003 *\li It is legitimate to pass a 'prefix' or 'suffix' that has
1004 * its name data stored someplace other than the dedicated buffer.
1005 * This is useful to avoid name copying in the calling function.
1006 *
1007 *\li It is also legitimate to pass a 'prefix' or 'suffix' that is
1008 * the same dns_name_t as 'name'.
1009 *
1010 * Requires:
1011 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1012 *
1013 *\li 'suffixlabels' cannot exceed the number of labels in 'name'.
1014 *
1015 * \li 'prefix' is a valid name or NULL, and cannot be read-only.
1016 *
1017 *\li 'suffix' is a valid name or NULL, and cannot be read-only.
1018 *
1019 * Ensures:
1020 *
1021 *\li On success:
1022 * If 'prefix' is not NULL it will contain the least significant
1023 * labels.
1024 * If 'suffix' is not NULL it will contain the most significant
1025 * labels. dns_name_countlabels(suffix) will be equal to
1026 * suffixlabels.
1027 *
1028 *\li On failure:
1029 * Either 'prefix' or 'suffix' is invalidated (depending
1030 * on which one the problem was encountered with).
1031 *
1032 * Returns:
1033 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS No worries. (This function should always success).
1034 */
1035
1036isc_result_t
1037dns_name_dup(const dns_name_t *source, isc_mem_t *mctx,
1038 dns_name_t *target);
1039/*%<
1040 * Make 'target' a dynamically allocated copy of 'source'.
1041 *
1042 * Requires:
1043 *
1044 *\li 'source' is a valid non-empty name.
1045 *
1046 *\li 'target' is a valid name that is not read-only.
1047 *
1048 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
1049 */
1050
1051isc_result_t
1052dns_name_dupwithoffsets(const dns_name_t *source, isc_mem_t *mctx,
1053 dns_name_t *target);
1054/*%<
1055 * Make 'target' a read-only dynamically allocated copy of 'source'.
1056 * 'target' will also have a dynamically allocated offsets table.
1057 *
1058 * Requires:
1059 *
1060 *\li 'source' is a valid non-empty name.
1061 *
1062 *\li 'target' is a valid name that is not read-only.
1063 *
1064 *\li 'target' has no offsets table.
1065 *
1066 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
1067 */
1068
1069void
1070dns_name_free(dns_name_t *name, isc_mem_t *mctx);
1071/*%<
1072 * Free 'name'.
1073 *
1074 * Requires:
1075 *
1076 *\li 'name' is a valid name created previously in 'mctx' by dns_name_dup().
1077 *
1078 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
1079 *
1080 * Ensures:
1081 *
1082 *\li All dynamic resources used by 'name' are freed and the name is
1083 * invalidated.
1084 */
1085
1086isc_result_t
1087dns_name_digest(const dns_name_t *name, dns_digestfunc_t digest, void *arg);
1088/*%<
1089 * Send 'name' in DNSSEC canonical form to 'digest'.
1090 *
1091 * Requires:
1092 *
1093 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1094 *
1095 *\li 'digest' is a valid dns_digestfunc_t.
1096 *
1097 * Ensures:
1098 *
1099 *\li If successful, the DNSSEC canonical form of 'name' will have been
1100 * sent to 'digest'.
1101 *
1102 *\li If digest() returns something other than ISC_R_SUCCESS, that result
1103 * will be returned as the result of dns_name_digest().
1104 *
1105 * Returns:
1106 *
1107 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1108 *
1109 *\li Many other results are possible if not successful.
1110 *
1111 */
1112
1113bool
1114dns_name_dynamic(const dns_name_t *name);
1115/*%<
1116 * Returns whether there is dynamic memory associated with this name.
1117 *
1118 * Requires:
1119 *
1120 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1121 *
1122 * Returns:
1123 *
1124 *\li 'true' if the name is dynamic otherwise 'false'.
1125 */
1126
1127isc_result_t
1128dns_name_print(const dns_name_t *name, FILE *stream);
1129/*%<
1130 * Print 'name' on 'stream'.
1131 *
1132 * Requires:
1133 *
1134 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1135 *
1136 *\li 'stream' is a valid stream.
1137 *
1138 * Returns:
1139 *
1140 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1141 *
1142 *\li Any error that dns_name_totext() can return.
1143 */
1144
1145void
1146dns_name_format(const dns_name_t *name, char *cp, unsigned int size);
1147/*%<
1148 * Format 'name' as text appropriate for use in log messages.
1149 *
1150 * Store the formatted name at 'cp', writing no more than
1151 * 'size' bytes. The resulting string is guaranteed to be
1152 * null terminated.
1153 *
1154 * The formatted name will have a terminating dot only if it is
1155 * the root.
1156 *
1157 * This function cannot fail, instead any errors are indicated
1158 * in the returned text.
1159 *
1160 * Requires:
1161 *
1162 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1163 *
1164 *\li 'cp' points a valid character array of size 'size'.
1165 *
1166 *\li 'size' > 0.
1167 *
1168 */
1169
1170isc_result_t
1171dns_name_tostring(const dns_name_t *source, char **target, isc_mem_t *mctx);
1172/*%<
1173 * Convert 'name' to string format, allocating sufficient memory to
1174 * hold it (free with isc_mem_free()).
1175 *
1176 * Differs from dns_name_format in that it allocates its own memory.
1177 *
1178 * Requires:
1179 *
1180 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
1181 *\li 'target' is not NULL.
1182 *\li '*target' is NULL.
1183 *
1184 * Returns:
1185 *
1186 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
1187 *\li ISC_R_NOMEMORY
1188 *
1189 *\li Any error that dns_name_totext() can return.
1190 */
1191
1192isc_result_t
1193dns_name_fromstring(dns_name_t *target, const char *src, unsigned int options,
1194 isc_mem_t *mctx);
1195isc_result_t
1196dns_name_fromstring2(dns_name_t *target, const char *src,
1197 const dns_name_t *origin, unsigned int options,
1198 isc_mem_t *mctx);
1199/*%<
1200 * Convert a string to a name and place it in target, allocating memory
1201 * as necessary. 'options' has the same semantics as that of
1202 * dns_name_fromtext().
1203 *
1204 * If 'target' has a buffer then the name will be copied into it rather than
1205 * memory being allocated.
1206 *
1207 * Requires:
1208 *
1209 * \li 'target' is a valid name that is not read-only.
1210 * \li 'src' is not NULL.
1211 *
1212 * Returns:
1213 *
1214 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1215 *
1216 *\li Any error that dns_name_fromtext() can return.
1217 *
1218 *\li Any error that dns_name_dup() can return.
1219 */
1220
1221isc_result_t
1222dns_name_settotextfilter(dns_name_totextfilter_t proc);
1223/*%<
1224 * Set / clear a thread specific function 'proc' to be called at the
1225 * end of dns_name_totext().
1226 *
1227 * Note: Under Windows you need to call "dns_name_settotextfilter(NULL);"
1228 * prior to exiting the thread otherwise memory will be leaked.
1229 * For other platforms, which are pthreads based, this is still a good
1230 * idea but not required.
1231 *
1232 * Returns
1233 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1234 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTED
1235 */
1236
1237#define DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE (DNS_NAME_MAXTEXT + 1)
1238/*%<
1239 * Suggested size of buffer passed to dns_name_format().
1240 * Includes space for the terminating NULL.
1241 */
1242
1243isc_result_t
1244dns_name_copy(const dns_name_t *source, dns_name_t *dest, isc_buffer_t *target);
1245/*%<
1246 * Makes 'dest' refer to a copy of the name in 'source'. The data are
1247 * either copied to 'target' or the dedicated buffer in 'dest'.
1248 *
1249 * Requires:
1250 * \li 'source' is a valid name.
1251 *
1252 * \li 'dest' is an initialized name with a dedicated buffer.
1253 *
1254 * \li 'target' is NULL or an initialized buffer.
1255 *
1256 * \li Either dest has a dedicated buffer or target != NULL.
1257 *
1258 * Ensures:
1259 *
1260 *\li On success, the used space in target is updated.
1261 *
1262 * Returns:
1263 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1264 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
1265 */
1266
1267bool
1268dns_name_ishostname(const dns_name_t *name, bool wildcard);
1269/*%<
1270 * Return if 'name' is a valid hostname. RFC 952 / RFC 1123.
1271 * If 'wildcard' is true then allow the first label of name to
1272 * be a wildcard.
1273 * The root is also accepted.
1274 *
1275 * Requires:
1276 * 'name' to be valid.
1277 */
1278
1279
1280bool
1281dns_name_ismailbox(const dns_name_t *name);
1282/*%<
1283 * Return if 'name' is a valid mailbox. RFC 821.
1284 *
1285 * Requires:
1286 * \li 'name' to be valid.
1287 */
1288
1289bool
1290dns_name_internalwildcard(const dns_name_t *name);
1291/*%<
1292 * Return if 'name' contains a internal wildcard name.
1293 *
1294 * Requires:
1295 * \li 'name' to be valid.
1296 */
1297
1298void
1299dns_name_destroy(void);
1300/*%<
1301 * Cleanup dns_name_settotextfilter() / dns_name_totext() state.
1302 *
1303 * This should be called as part of the final cleanup process.
1304 *
1305 * Note: dns_name_settotextfilter(NULL); should be called for all
1306 * threads which have called dns_name_settotextfilter() with a
1307 * non-NULL argument prior to calling dns_name_destroy();
1308 */
1309
1310bool
1311dns_name_isdnssd(const dns_name_t *owner);
1312/*%<
1313 * Determine if the 'owner' is a DNS-SD prefix.
1314 */
1315
1316bool
1317dns_name_isrfc1918(const dns_name_t *owner);
1318/*%<
1319 * Determine if the 'name' is in the RFC 1918 reverse namespace.
1320 */
1321
1322bool
1323dns_name_isula(const dns_name_t *owner);
1324/*%<
1325 * Determine if the 'name' is in the ULA reverse namespace.
1326 */
1327
1328bool
1329dns_name_istat(const dns_name_t *name);
1330/*
1331 * Determine if 'name' is a potential 'trust-anchor-telemetry' name.
1332 */

1334ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
1335
1336/*
1337 *** High Performance Macros
1338 ***/
1339
1340/*
1341 * WARNING: Use of these macros by applications may require recompilation
1342 * of the application in some situations where calling the function
1343 * would not.
1344 *
1345 * WARNING: No assertion checking is done for these macros.
1346 */
1347
1348#define DNS_NAME_INIT(n, o) \
1349do { \
1350 dns_name_t *_n = (n); \
1351 /* memset(_n, 0, sizeof(*_n)); */ \
1352 _n->magic = DNS_NAME_MAGIC; \
1353 _n->ndata = NULL; \
1354 _n->length = 0; \
1355 _n->labels = 0; \
1356 _n->attributes = 0; \
1357 _n->offsets = (o); \
1358 _n->buffer = NULL; \
1359 ISC_LINK_INIT(_n, link); \
1360 ISC_LIST_INIT(_n->list); \
1361} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1362
1363#define DNS_NAME_RESET(n) \
1364do { \
1365 (n)->ndata = NULL; \
1366 (n)->length = 0; \
1367 (n)->labels = 0; \
1368 (n)->attributes &= ~DNS_NAMEATTR_ABSOLUTE; \
1369 if ((n)->buffer != NULL) \
1370 isc_buffer_clear((n)->buffer); \
1371} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1372
1373#define DNS_NAME_SETBUFFER(n, b) \
1374 (n)->buffer = (b)
1375
1376#define DNS_NAME_ISABSOLUTE(n) \
1377 (((n)->attributes & DNS_NAMEATTR_ABSOLUTE) != 0 ? true : false)
1378
1379#define DNS_NAME_COUNTLABELS(n) \
1380 ((n)->labels)
1381
1382#define DNS_NAME_TOREGION(n, r) \
1383do { \
1384 (r)->base = (n)->ndata; \
1385 (r)->length = (n)->length; \
1386} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1387
1388#define DNS_NAME_SPLIT(n, l, p, s) \
1389do { \
1390 dns_name_t *_n = (n); \
1391 dns_name_t *_p = (p); \
1392 dns_name_t *_s = (s); \
1393 unsigned int _l = (l); \
1394 if (_p != NULL) \
1395 dns_name_getlabelsequence(_n, 0, _n->labels - _l, _p); \
1396 if (_s != NULL) \
1397 dns_name_getlabelsequence(_n, _n->labels - _l, _l, _s); \
1398} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1399
1400#ifdef DNS_NAME_USEINLINE
1401
1402#define dns_name_init(n, o) DNS_NAME_INIT(n, o)
1403#define dns_name_reset(n) DNS_NAME_RESET(n)
1404#define dns_name_setbuffer(n, b) DNS_NAME_SETBUFFER(n, b)
1405#define dns_name_countlabels(n) DNS_NAME_COUNTLABELS(n)
1406#define dns_name_isabsolute(n) DNS_NAME_ISABSOLUTE(n)
1407#define dns_name_toregion(n, r) DNS_NAME_TOREGION(n, r)
1408#define dns_name_split(n, l, p, s) DNS_NAME_SPLIT(n, l, p, s)
1409
1410#endif /* DNS_NAME_USEINLINE */
1411
1412#endif /* DNS_NAME_H */
1413
